answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I have found a number of documents and links that I believe will be helpful in answering your question.
The first document is a link to policy suggestions from the National Association of Chronic Disease Directors.  Their document, an Evidence Based Public Health: A Course in Chronic Disease Prevention uses science and the preferences of a community to establish a better way to promote public health. The bottom of the page includes links to training options.
http://www.chronicdisease.org/professional-development/evidence-based-public-health-1
I also found a link to Pinellas County, FL’s health department Website. On the page below they highlight the goals of their office and the way they go about promoting preventative measures.
http://www.pinellashealth.com/chronicdiseasesprevention.asp
Additionally, I have included links to a variety of other state’s health services WebPages about chronic disease prevention. All the Websites included both general and specific information about how each location handles and promotes prevention.
1.  Contra Costa County, CA: http://cchealth.org/groups/chronic_disease/framework.php
2.  Whatcom County, WA: http://www.co.whatcom.wa.us/health/community/chronicdiseaseprevention.jsp
3.  New York, NY: http://www.nyc.gov/html/doh/html/cdp/cdp.shtml
4.  Alaska: http://www.hss.state.ak.us/dph/chronic/obesity/pan.htm
ICMA also has some literature available about creating a healthier work environment overall. I have included that link below it would like more information.
http://bookstore.icma.org/Creating_a_Culture_of_Health__P1879C34.cfm?UserID=5835737&jsessionid=4e303f96e0a86e512524
Finally, the CDC has a lot of helpful information about chronic disease prevention in general which may help in your training process.
http://www.cdc.gov/CommunitiesPuttingPreventiontoWork/resources/index.htm#Planning 
I have also included a document about council training in general which may offer some help in conjunction with all the other chronic disease prevention information. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/5169/Preparing_Councils_for_Their_Work
I hope these links are helpful!
Ali Iannolo
ICMA Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org
